definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
falsetto, same as 假聲|假声

sentences.english: Specifically, the clarity and projection of the altissimo range.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，可以影响高音区发音的清晰度和穿透力吗？

sentences.english: She was the soprano part leader in the University Choir, HKUSTSU.
sentences.chinese: 林氏曾为香港科技大学学生会合唱团女高音声部部长。

sentences.english: A: I heard you had great seats for the Three Tenors concert in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 我听说你买到了世界三大男高音北京演唱会的好票。

sentences.english: One NOTE is a treble clef.
Soprano, alto, tenor and bass constitute the four vocal parts.
sentences.chinese: 这是男高音和女低音的组合。

sentences.english: His high notes quavered when he sang the “Internationale”.
sentences.chinese: 他唱《国际歌》时高音发颤。

sentences.english: That opera tenor can no loger hit the high notes as he used to.
sentences.chinese: 那位歌剧男高音已不能像以前那样唱高音了。

sentences.english: That opera tenor can no loger hit the high notes as he used to.
sentences.chinese: 那位歌剧男高音已不能像以前那样唱高音了。

sentences.english: Soprano Tan Jing and Lei Jia will perform the title role Mulan.
sentences.chinese: 这部歌剧将由女高音谭晶和雷佳扮演主角木兰。

sentences.english: Goodwife asks famous tenor singer Simier sings a lyric song.
sentences.chinese: 女主人请闻名男高音歌唱家斯米尔唱一首抒情歌曲。

sentences.english: In this passage the violins double the sopranos.
sentences.chinese: 小提琴在本乐节兼作高音乐器演奏。

sentences.english: Although he is visually impaired, he did not abandon his dream of becoming a tenor.
sentences.chinese: 视障的他并没有因此就放弃成为男高音的梦想。

sentences.english: There are three of them, the Three Tenors.
sentences.chinese: 由三个呢，世界三大男高音。

sentences.english: The mediocre talent just never hits the high notes that the top talent hits all the time.
sentences.chinese: 平庸者就是永远达不到天才随时能唱出的高音。

sentences.english: For the high and mid toms , it's best to use the same model mic.
sentences.chinese: 在高音和中音桶鼓上最好使用相同型号的麦克。

sentences.english: A special positioning of tweeters and woofers create an ultimate experience.
sentences.chinese: 高音和低音的特殊定位创造出一种终极体验。

definition: falsetto, same as 假聲|假声
natural voice/modal voice/true voice/opposite: falsetto 假聲|假声[jia3 sheng1]
falsetto/opposite: natural or true voice 真聲|真声[zhen1 sheng1]
to be off-key or out of tune (while singing) (colloquial)
